pullRequest.title: Refactor Text & Graphic Manager to use queues
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #1464
This PR is ready for review.
Risk
This PR makes minor API changes.
Testing Plan

 I have verified that I have not introduced new warnings in this PR (or explain why below)
 I have run the unit tests with this PR
 I have tested this PR against Core and verified behavior (if applicable, if not applicable, explain why below).
 I have tested Android, Java SE, and Java EE

Unit Tests
Unit test: TextAndGraphicUpdateOperationTest.java and TextAndGraphicManagerTests
Core Tests
Tested by updating Text and graphics on display in various ways in succession.
Tested against core release 6.1 with Generic HMI,
Tested onManticore,
Tested on Sync 3.0 TDK-X2-U2-150
Summary
This PR refactors the Text and Graphics sub-manager of the screen manager to use queues like the soft button and choice set managers.
Enhancements

Improved internal template text and graphic handling.

CLA

 I have signed the CLA

nodes.bodyText: Is there a specific reason for removing this test? we can update it to assert that the object value is null. The same comment applies to the other method in this class.

Can we add the @OverRide back and add the abstract method to the base class? it is better to make sure that both child classes implement the same methods. The same comment applies to the JavaSE copy of the file

The T&G manager needs to inform the SB manager about the latest mainField1 value so the SB manager doesn't send a SHOW with outdated value and override mainField1. Especially if the T&G modified the mainField1 value internally (for example to assemble multiple texts in one line). The SB manager has no way to know the latest value for the mainField1
I suggest checking if name is null as well to avoid potential NPE. The same comment applies to getSecondaryGraphic()
They are some unused imports in this class
There are some unused imports in this class.
I think this class and everything inside it should be package protected as we don't want to expose internal APIs to developers
The sentShow seems to be unused
This class and most of its APIs can be package-private. Some APIS can also be private if they are only used within the operation
We should set defaultMainWindowCapability = null here
Does closing the queue work instead of canceling each task individually?

You don't need a method and var for canceling the task. The parent Task class already has a state. So you can call task.cancelTask() to mark the task as cancelled. And to check if it is canceled use
if (getState() == Task.CANCELED) ...
